verses.kjv: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.
verses.ct: But now men younger than me mock me — men whose fathers I wouldn't have trusted to work alongside my sheepdogs.

verses.kjv: Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?
verses.ct: What good was the strength of their hands to me? Their vigor had completely wasted away.

verses.kjv: For want and famine they were solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste.
verses.ct: Gaunt from poverty and hunger, they wandered the barren wasteland at night,

verses.kjv: Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.
verses.ct: picking wild plants among the bushes and eating the roots of broom trees.

verses.kjv: They were driven forth from among men, (they cried after them as after a thief;)
verses.ct: They were chased away from society, with people shouting after them as if they were thieves.

verses.kjv: To dwell in the cliffs of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.
verses.ct: They had to live in the sides of ravines, in holes in the ground, and among the rocks.

verses.kjv: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.
verses.ct: They howled among the bushes and huddled together under the thornbushes.

verses.kjv: They were children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.
verses.ct: They were the children of fools — yes, children of nobodies — outcasts driven from the land.

verses.kjv: And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.
verses.ct: Now I've become the subject of their mocking songs; I'm a joke to them.

verses.kjv: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.
verses.ct: They despise me and keep their distance, and they don't hesitate to spit in my presence.

verses.kjv: Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.
verses.ct: Because God has cut my bowstring and brought me low, they've thrown off all restraint around me.

verses.kjv: Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.
verses.ct: On my right side this mob rises up; they trip my feet and build their siege ramps against me.

verses.kjv: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.
verses.ct: They tear up my path and work to bring about my ruin — and no one stops them.

verses.kjv: They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters: in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.
verses.ct: They rush at me like water through a wide breach in a wall; amid the wreckage they come rolling over me.

verses.kjv: Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.
verses.ct: Terrors overwhelm me; my dignity is swept away like the wind, and my prosperity vanishes like a cloud.

verses.kjv: And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.
verses.ct: Now my soul is poured out within me; days of suffering have seized me.

verses.kjv: My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.
verses.ct: At night my bones are racked with pain, and the gnawing inside me never stops.

verses.kjv: By the great force of my disease is my garment changed: it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.
verses.ct: With tremendous force my disease has twisted my clothing around me; it chokes me like the collar of my tunic.

verses.kjv: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.
verses.ct: God has thrown me into the mud, and I've been reduced to nothing but dust and ashes.

verses.kjv: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me not.
verses.ct: I cry out to you, but you don't answer me; I stand before you, but you pay me no attention.

verses.kjv: Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.
verses.ct: You have turned cruel toward me; with the full force of your power you oppose me.

verses.kjv: Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it, and dissolvest my substance.
verses.ct: You lift me up into the wind and toss me around in the storm, dissolving everything I have.

verses.kjv: For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.
verses.ct: I know that you are bringing me to death — to the place where every living person must go.

verses.kjv: Howbeit he will not stretch out his hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction.
verses.ct: Surely no one reaches out to strike a person who is already in ruins, when they cry out in their distress.

verses.kjv: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? was not my soul grieved for the poor?
verses.ct: Didn't I weep for those going through hard times? Wasn't my soul grieved for the poor?

verses.kjv: When I looked for good, then evil came unto me: and when I waited for light, there came darkness.
verses.ct: Yet when I hoped for good, evil came instead; when I waited for light, darkness arrived.

verses.kjv: My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.
verses.ct: My insides are churning and never settle down; days of suffering confront me at every turn.

verses.kjv: I went mourning without the sun: I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.
verses.ct: I walk around in darkness, without any comfort; I stand up in the assembly and cry for help.

verses.kjv: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.
verses.ct: I've become a brother to jackals and a companion to ostriches.

verses.kjv: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.
verses.ct: My skin turns black and peels off me, and my bones burn with fever.

verses.kjv: My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.
verses.ct: My harp plays only funeral songs now, and my flute sounds only the melody of weeping.
